00032 // Using the DASVHMap class, build a parser for the DAS and add functions
00033 // that provide access to the variables, their attributes and values.
00034 //
00035 // jhrg 7/25/94
00036 
00037 #ifndef _das_h
00038 #define _das_h 1
00039

00043 #endif
00044 #endif

00057 using std::cout;

00128 class DAS : public AttrTable {
00129 private:
00130 protected:
00131     AttrTable *das_find(string name);
00132 
00133 public:
00134     DAS(AttrTable *dflt=(AttrTable *)NULL, unsigned int sz=0);
00135 
00136     DAS(AttrTable *attr_table, string name);
00137 
00138     virtual ~DAS();
00139 
00140     Pix first_var();
00141     void next_var(Pix p);
00142     string get_name(Pix p);
00143     AttrTable *get_table(Pix p);
00144 
00146     AttrTable::Attr_iter var_begin() ;
00147 
00150     AttrTable::Attr_iter var_end() ;
00151 
00153     string get_name(Attr_iter &i);
00154 
00156     AttrTable *get_table(Attr_iter &i);
00157 
00158 
00159     AttrTable *get_table(const string &name);
00160     AttrTable *get_table(const char *name); // avoid converting char * to Pix
00161 
00162     AttrTable *add_table(const string &name, AttrTable *at);
00163     AttrTable *add_table(const char *name, AttrTable *at);
00164 
00165     void parse(string fname);
00166     void parse(int fd);
00167     void parse(FILE *in=stdin);
00168 
00169     void print(ostream &os = cout, bool dereference = false);
00170 
00171     void print(FILE *out, bool dereference = false);
00172 };

00221  * Revision 1.29.4.4  2002/09/05 22:52:54  pwest
00222  * Replaced the GNU data structures SLList and DLList with the STL container
00223  * class vector<>. To maintain use of Pix, changed the Pix.h header file to
00224  * redefine Pix to be an IteratorAdapter. Usage remains the same and all code
00225  * outside of the DAP should compile and link with no problems. Added methods
00226  * to the different classes where Pix is used to include methods to use STL
00227  * iterators. Replaced the use of Pix within the DAP to use iterators instead.

00237  * Revision 1.29.4.3  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00238  * Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00239  * I added those where they were needed.
00240  * In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00241  * just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00242  * before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00243  * just good form when using delete.
00244  * I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00245  * making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00246  * set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00247  * comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00248  * characters on their own.
00249  *

00254  * Significant changes and improvements to the AttrTable and DAS classes. DAS
00255  * now is a child of AttrTable, which makes attributes behave uniformly at
00256  * all levels of the DAS object. Alias now work. I've added unit tests for
00257  * several methods in AttrTable and some of the functions in parser-util.cc.
00258  * In addition, all of the DAS tests now work.

00269  * Revision 1.28  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00270  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00271  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00272  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00273  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00274  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00275  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
